item.title: kubernetes-pause-pod
item.description:
The Deployment controller implements a crucial function within a Kubernetes cluster: the ability to horizontally scale and shrink Pods. This capability was essential for traditional cloud-era platforms.

Encountering a business scenario where you need to modify data in a database, restarting Pod nodes after adjustments. However, during Pod operation, table fields are continuously being updated, requiring temporary pausing of application updates to the tables, restoring the Pod after adjusting the data.

Besides brute force deletion of the Deployment, are there other ways to achieve a similar pause effect?

Before seeing the answer, many people might not have realized it, and upon seeing the answer, they would smile knowingly, their brains hadn’t twisted, and their thinking remained stuck in the era of directly operating processes, thinking about directly manipulating business processes.
